title: What is session work and how does it work? - Quora

response.answer_text: Session work is simple, a musician is hired to play at a recording session. Sometimes this work is for a flat fee, sometimes with performance royalties in addition to a fee. Musicians who undertake session work are required to do a job, to sing a song, play guitar, bass, drums etc in a way that suits the song without getting in the way of the star, often without rehearsal and often sight reading from sheet music. The session player may never even see the artist on who’s music they’re performing… how many bricklayers meet the person who buys the house? It’s not work for anyone who wants to be a star, few make it out of that role, and can be a grind as you’re more often than not required to suppress your own creativity and just play the part as written. It is, however, great work for anyone who want’s to make a living from music, so long as they are really good players and don’t mind the grind and practice on the way to getting there, the long hours, the lack of adulation… Over the years there have been session players, and studio bands who have made it big. Pretty much everyone in Toto were session guys, you hear Steve Lukather’s guitar all over MJ’s Thriller album. The Swampers were the Muscle Shoals house band, immortalised lyrically in Sweet Home Alabama. Booker T and the MGs were the house band of STAX records and performed on all kinds of soul and blues tunes in addition to their own releases. Jimmy Page played guitar on Tom Jones’ It’s Not Unusual before joining the Yardbirds and later forming Zeppelin. These are just the exception, not the rule. It makes me want to ask some questions though. Why did you take your daughter to a studio? Had she sung or played before ‘the guy’ asked? How old is she? Does she want to be a star? Objectively, is she any good?

Session work simply is hiring a musician on a per hour basis to record on an artists material. They are usually exceptionally flexible in styles and sounds, and if they play an instrument they usually have am arsenal of weapons to pull out at anytime. They are renowned for being disciplined as they aren't just musos they are businrssmsn who keep their own diaries and must be on time. Word of mouth business is critical for them so they are often heard and not seen !
